We arenâ€™t supposed to be doing any sort of decision-making based on browser User-Agent Strings. But, ya know, collectively, we do.
Karl Dubost notes that there is a significant change coming to them, notably moving the version integer past â€¦

articles.author: Alex Standiford
articles.description:
I believe that a traditional WordPress theme should be able to work as effectively as a static site or a headless web app. The overwhelming majority of WordPress websites are built with a good olâ€™ fashioned WordPress theme. Most of â€¦
The post How to Build a Nearly Headless WordPress Website appeared first on CSS-Tricks. You can support CSS-Tricks by being an MVP Supporter.

articles.author: Kev Bonett
articles.description:
I love CSS Grid. I love how, with just a few lines of code, we can achieve fully responsive grid layouts, often without any media queries at all. Iâ€™m quite comfortable wrangling CSS Grid to produce interesting layouts, while keeping â€¦

articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description:
One way to work with Custom Properties is to think of them as design tokens. Colors, spacings, fonts, and whatnot. You set them at the root of the page and use them throughout your CSS. Very useful, and the classic â€¦

articles.description:

Browse through SaaS communities on Twitter, LinkedIn, Reddit, Discord, you name it and youâ€™ll see a common theme appear in many of them. That theme can go by many names: BI, analytics, insights and â€¦

Web-browser for research that helps programmers think clearly.
With Bonsai, rather than being like, Iâ€™m going to go use my web browser now, you hit Option + Space and it brings up a browser. Itâ€™s either full-screen or a â€¦

As someone just sittinâ€™ back watching CSS evolve, it feels like weâ€™re at one of the hottest moments of innovation in CSS history. It was really something when we got flexbox across all browsers, and not terribly long after, grid. â€¦

Ahmad Shadeed blogs the sentiment that we might not need to lean on position: absolute as much as we might have in the past. For one thing: stacking elements. For example, if you have a stack of elements that should â€¦
